result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Denzell Helton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge. Court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of earnings and funds.
With credit for 19 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.
Mental health evaluation and comply with recommended treatment and counseling.

Attend a parenting class.
No driving without a valid driver's license.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Provide any prescriptions to agent before filling.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Denzell Helton

Filed:
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Defendant Anthony Denzell Helton in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Defense counsel requested another date for sentencing.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Plea hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
